dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Naveen-ul-Haq b Mirwais Ashraf 80 (98b 9x4 0x6 148m) SR: 81.63

dismissalComment.html: he was denied a wicket earlier in the innings when a catch was put down at point, but he finally has his man. Tamim looks to slap this over long-off, but managed to get the toe-end of the bat. This time, he managed to hit it down the throat of the long-off fielder Naveen, who nearly over-ran it, but kept his composure to take it in the end. Wonder if their inability to turn the strike in the previous over played a part in this wicket. That's a wicket Afghanistan would gladly take at the moment

dismissalText.long: c Mirwais Ashraf b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah c Mirwais Ashraf b Mohammad Nabi 62 (74b 5x4 2x6 91m) SR: 83.78

dismissalComment.html: where did that come from? Mahmudullah can't believe what he's just done. The idea was right, but he didn't get enough bat on it. Walks across the stumps and sweeps a flatter delivery with the spin straight to Ashraf at deep backward square leg. He wanted to hit it a lot finer, but ended up dragging it a little. The ball was dying on Ashraf, but he adjusted well to complete the catch.
Dawlat strikes in his first over. Banged in short and kicks up outside off, Sarkar looks to pull. Loses his shape and ends up flapping a catch into the hands of midwicket. Simple catch

Shakib's wicket adds to the late slide. No fifty for him. Banged in short, rises outside off. Shakib had to fetch it from there, which means he can't control the slog-pull. Ends up skying a catch to deep midwicket. Good fightback from Afghanistan
back-of-the-hand legcutter from Dawlat. Taskin could not spot the change-up. He aims a wild leg-side smite, early into it, and ends up dragging it back onto the stumps

Zadran finishes the innings with Taijul's wicket. Unfurls the back-of-the-hand legcutter again. Taijul seeks to loft it away. He can't get hold of it, can't impart enough power. Just spoons it in the air. Two fielders converge near the mid-off region. Rahmat ultimately takes it, Dawlat claims a four-wicket haul

headshotImage.caption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rashid Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: deceived by the googly this time. Looks for an ugly slog sweep, but failed to get underneath it. He was already through with the swing even before the ball got to him, the middle and off stump is disturbed.

another appeal for lbw, and the umpire thought long, before raising the finger. The bounce was in question here. It was another googly, Sabbir was stuck to the crease as he looked to whip it across the line. He was hit on the flap of the pad, and replays suggest the ball may have missed the stumps.

dismissalComment.html: Soumya hangs onto a catch and Mirpur erupts! Taijul takes the key wicket of Shahidi. This was pushed through fuller. He goes low and slog-sweeps it in the air. Gets more height rather than distance. Soumya snaffles the skier at deep midwicket

dismissalText.long: st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Rahmat Shah st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 71 (93b 2x4 3x6 134m) SR: 76.34

dismissalComment.html: Shakib provides the hosts with the breakthrough and becomes Bangladesh's leading wicket-taker in ODIs. The batsman skipped down the track, Shakib slowed it up outside off. He is nowhere close to the pitch. Has a wild swipe to leg and misses. Mushfiq does the rest
Taskin strikes on return Short offcutter, grips in the surface. Nabi swings in the air. Can't impart enough strength holes out to long-off running to his left. Good catch
What an over from Taskin! He takes down Stanikzai. Good length and on a fourth-stump line. He slogs across the line and finds long-on. Taskin has his hands aloft in joy, Mirpur laps him up
pins him plumb in front! He shuffles across the off stump, eyes up the leg side with an expansive swipe. Misses this full, straight ball and sees the finger go up
Bangladesh win by seven runs! Full toss on middle, Dawlat attacks it and ends up carving a catch to long-off running in

headshotImage.caption: Shabir Noori player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shabir Noori player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: as far as decisions go, you have to say that's the simplest of the lot. With that Shakib equals Abdur Razzak's record for most ODI wickets (207) for Bangladesh. This was a typical left-arm spinner's delivery, an arm ball that kept coming back in to beat Noori's forward prod. He was plumb in front of middle. One brings two, they say. I agree

dismissalText.long: c Sabbir Rahman b Taskin Ahmed
dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran c Sabbir Rahman b Taskin Ahmed 2 (3b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 66.66

commentTextItems.html: Bangladesh win by seven runs! Full toss on middle, Dawlat attacks it and ends up carving a catch to long-off running in

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.30pm Afghanistan seemed to be ahead in the chase during the 144-run stand between Rahmat and Shahidi. But Shakib bowled an excellent spell and tipped the balance in the home team's favour. When he removed Rahmat, he became Bangladesh's leading wicket-taker in ODIs. The returning Taskin then nailed the yorkers at the death to seal Bangladesh's tense win.

Asghar Stanikzai: Congratulations to Bangladesh. The bowlers bowled very well, that's why they won the match. Rashid and Naveen restricted Bangladesh. At one stage they looked at 280-290. At the end, we played some poor shots.

Mashrafe Mortaza: Afghan played really well, our catching was costing us. Later on, Shakib and Taskin were good with the ball. Last three months we were working hard, but the way we played we were not up to the mark. We could have scored 280-plus, but the set batsmen got out. Taskin has just recovered from the tests, Rubel is coming from injury. This match will boost them up.

Shakib Al Hasan, Man of the Match: We knew this game was going to be tricky. We are playing ODIs after almost a year. We were careful and short by 20 runs. The spinners bowled really well and were exceptional. The roles is the team is to take the game to the end. Tamim played a brilliant knock, Imrul started well.
Thanks for joining us. Looking forward to your company for the second ODI. Until then, buh-bye.
Z Ikram: "2-0-11-4, That spell by Taskin!"
Vaseem: "Well played Afghanistan. You fought till the last. Best wishes for the upcoming matches.

Nayeem: "What a Gem of a comeback for Taskin, he was in immense pressure after that "bowling action" test. Returning after cleared action and getting 4 wickets proves the character he have. Salute, sir."

commentTextItems.html: pretty full and just a shade outside off, Dawlat has an almighty slog, only to connect with thin air. Taskin has recovered well after a poor start
low full toss on off, jammed down to long-on. They come back for the second. The throw is to the keeper, Mushfiq takes the bails off. But Dawlat is just in
full toss, thuds into the back thigh, they sneak a leg bye, this was slipping down. This lbw appeal is shot down

dismissalText.commentary: Shabir Noori lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 9 (24b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 37.5

dismissalComment.html: as far as decisions go, you have to say that's the simplest of the lot. With that Shakib equals Abdur Razzak's record for most ODI wickets (207) for Bangladesh. This was a typical left-arm spinner's delivery, an arm ball that kept coming back in to beat Noori's forward prod. He was plumb in front of middle. One brings two, they say. I agree

dismissalComment.html: the Bangladesh captain gives him a send-off with a few choice words. This was a slower delivery that gripped the surface, Shahzad looked to ease it past the keeper, but could only manage to glove that to Mushfiqur. Mirpur comes alive. That was a much-needed wicket for Bangladesh

milestones.description: Hashmatullah and Rahmat Shah's 144-run partnership is AFG's highest for the 3rd wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 104 between Afsar Zazai and Nasir Jamal
Shakib has become the top wicket-taker for BAN in ODIs with 208 wickets, going past Abdur Razzak's 207
This is the highest match aggregate (523) involving teams Bangladesh & Afghanistan in ODIs
Shakib has scored 6 hundreds in ODIs, the most for BAN breaking Tamim Iqbal's record

stories.title: I compartmentalise bowling and captaincy - Mashrafe
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan in Bangladesh, 2016
stories.seoTitle: I compartmentalise bowling and captaincy, says Bangladesh's Mashrafe Mortaza
stories.summary: Mashrafe Mortaza said he has gradually developed the ability to separate his role as bowler from his role as limited-overs captain of Bangladesh

image.caption: Mashrafe Mortaza celebrates the wicket of Corey Anderson
image.longCaption: Mashrafe Mortaza celebrates the wicket of Corey Anderson, Bangladesh v New Zealand, World T20 2016, Group 2, Kolkata, March 26, 2016

stories.title: We'll improve with match practice - Shakib
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan in Bangladesh 2016-17
stories.seoTitle: We'll improve with match practice, says Bangladesh's Shakib Al Hasan
stories.summary: After Bangladesh's tight win over Afghanistan in the first ODI, Shakib Al Hasan said that the team now have the belief that they can win ODIs even when circumstances are not always in their favour

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan's wicket added to Bangladesh's late slide
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan's wicket added to Bangladesh's late slide, Bangladesh v Afghanistan, 1st ODI, Mirpur, September 25, 2016

stories.title: Sabbir Rahman slapped with code-of-conduct fine
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan in Bangladesh 2016
stories.seoTitle: Sabbir Rahman slapped with code-of-conduct fine by the ICC
stories.summary: Bangladesh batsman Sabbir Rahman has been handed two demerit points, per a disciplinary system brought into effect by the ICC on September 22. According to it, if his demerit points rise to four in a 24-month period, he could be facing a suspension

image.caption: Sabbir Rahman warms up for the third T20
